message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper proposes a method for label embedding in zero-shot learning, which is a common problem in computer vision and natural language processing. The paper uses matrix factorization and sparsity constraints to incorporate multiple label contexts, such as label hierarchy and attributes, into a unified framework. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper also involves semantic text representations and label description, which are related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
